messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., Ilja Preu? <I.Preuss@b...> wrote:
> So you don't ever have any bug in production code? Wow!

Of course I do, but if it's a pathological case (and assertions are
only there for pathological cases) I'm happy to bomb out all the way
to the top and dump a stack trace to the log (which the JVM does for
me). If it's not a pathological case, I don't use an assertion, I
throw some checked exception, catch it, log it and recover.

> Well, I don't have as much confidence in my code, so I would want
> to handle possible assertion-exceptions.

Well if you're going to handle AssertionFailedException, why not
handle some more useful exception like DatabaseDidntOpenException ?

i.e. If I think it's an error I can handle, I use a named, checked
exception. If it's an "all bets are off" case I use an assertion.

Alan
